body.p: Born Hannah Coleman in Kentucky. She was a free black living in Jeffersonville, Indiana across the river from Louisville in 1860. Worked as a washerwoman. Accused of helping to aid in a female slave's escape in Jefferson County, Kentucky. Tolliver was involved with the Underground Railroad as a conductor and has the distinction of being the first African American woman with a historical marker in Indiana.
Spouse: George Tolliver (worked as a boatman)
